page.title: 15THE SPANIARDS INN
page.content: In {Spaniards Road}there is an old toll gate. This was once at the entrance to the road running through the estate of the {Bishop of London,} right opposite {Spaniards Inn.}It is said that {Dick Turpin}used Spaniards Inn as a hide out. The landlord used to give him the the keys to the stables so that he could hide and make a quick getaway if necessary. This Inn was also used by the {Gordon Rioters} in 1780, when the landlord gave the rioters so much alcohol that they became incapable of resisting the troops and so saved {Kenwood House.} from destruction. The Inn got its name from the Spanish Ambassador who took a house there to shelter from the plague in the reign of James I.
